subject: Public Speaking
title: The Rhetorical Triangle
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Rhetorical Triangle.

hook.text: Every speech has three elements: the speaker, the audience, and the message. Change any one and the speech changes.

buildup.text: The rhetorical triangle maps these relationships. A great speech aligns all three perfectly.

discovery.text: Most failed speeches ignore the audience. They focus on what the speaker wants to say, not what listeners need.

twist.text: The same message delivered to engineers and to poets requires completely different approaches. Context is everything.

climax.text: The triangle reminds speakers that persuasion is a relationship, not a broadcast. You speak WITH an audience.

punchline.text: A speech is a triangle. Miss one side and it collapses.

quiz.question: What three elements make up the rhetorical triangle?
